article: I have been a nurse for seven years. I love my work. Now, my  _  is quite ill. He is 71 and has heart failure, and a lot of other medical  _  . Up until April of this year, he was able to  _  alone, drive, and take care of himself. His health has  _  down swiftly. I'm the only girl out of five children. Being the only girl and a  _  put me at the top of the caregiver list. Taking care of a sick parent is very difficult, not at all like taking care of other patients. I have to abandon my own  _  to be here with Dad. I know this is what I need to do but it is still  _  . I spend about 12-15 hours a day taking care of him. I want to spend all of the time that I can with him because I know that our  _  left together is short.. At the same time, I felt  _  that my brothers don't help more. Sometimes, it is days between their  _  . They have separate families and busy life...So do I. My eldest brother does  _  some. He stays at night. He comes in at 8: 00 or 9: 00 p.m. and lets me go home. My other  _  pop in for 10-15 minutesvisits. It is really annoying. They say they can't  _  seeing Daddy this way, which I  _  . It hurts me to see him so sick and  _  , too. But he's our Dad. He has taken care of us all his life. I just feel that we should do our part to take care of him now.
